div1.p: political interference than is the complaint of the Merchants of Benguella concerning the supposed meddling in trade to which I already referred and therefore it will be much better that at the missionaries on their return to Bailundo make a solemn declaration or oath according to their religion before witnessess and the authorities that they do not intend to influence in any prejudicial way the trade of Benguella, but that they simply go to preach the Gospel and the doctrine of Christ. The oath that I suggest would for my part be perfectly unnecessary but the public spirit in the country is irritated against the missionaries, and in as much as such a promise would be a means of pacifying and dispersing any doubts that may remain and which certainly can cost nothing to the conciliating and Evangelical spirit of the missionaries.
